name: Sydney**
descriptions: Sydney is a mercenary who specializes in relic hunting in the year 2277, and a temporary companion in Fallout 3.
Sydney is a self-taught survivor, who braved the wasteland all on her own since the age of fourteen; her mother was raped and killed by raiders,

The skills he taught her, especially gunsmithing and reloading, served her well over the years. She learned to always be ready for a fight, to the point of sleeping with a gun under her pillow all the time,

Sydney is loyal and professional. She never reneges on a deal and focuses on the task at hand, and typically works alone. When she has to work with someone, she prefers not to discuss her past and other personal topics. She dislikes men approaching her (a difficult thing to avoid, on account of her looks),
The player can obtain her unique SMG by delivering her a note from her father. See below for details.
* If she finishes the quest alive and makes it to Underworld.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Screw you! If you think you can get the Declaration by yourself, then have at it.

topics.topic_text: Let me ask you something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: That's all for now, I guess.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: Any interest in partnering up again?
topics.response_text: You know, I think I've had my fill of Wasteland roaming and picking through ruined buildings for a while.

topics.topic_text: What are you doing in Underworld?
topics.response_text: My new line of work, actually.

topics.topic_text: Since we're done now, why don't you tell me about yourself?
topics.response_text: Ha, I'm surprised that you care. Usually everyone looks out for themselves nowadays.

topics.topic_text: How did you get into the relic hunting business?
topics.response_text: I dunno. I grew up pretty much like every other girl in this crappy world. Spent most of my life just trying to keep away from Slavers.

topics.topic_text: You recovered all of that stuff in the Preservation Society's museum?
topics.response_text: Oh no. There is more than a lifetime's supply of grade A crap in that place. Couldn't possibly do it alone. Like you, he hires anyone off the street.

topics.topic_text: Nice gun. I've never seen one like that.
topics.response_text: Yeah, it is nice. I don't even sleep without it under my pillow.

topics.topic_text: Sydney, I found a note from your father. He didn't abandon you.
topics.response_text: What?!

topics.topic_text: What are you up to?
topics.response_text: Well, now that we brought back the Declaration, I think I'll take my cut of the earnings and head out to get drunk.

topics.topic_text: Here, take one of these Stimpaks. It should help.
topics.response_text: Thanks, I'll use it right away.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, I'm out of meds. Hang in there.
topics.response_text: Thanks, I'll try and keep it together.

topics.topic_text: You'll live, tough girl.
topics.response_text: You jerk.

topics.topic_text: Thanks, you're not so bad yourself.
topics.response_text: Well, with what I do for a living, you need to be.

topics.topic_text: Yep. I sure am.
topics.response_text: Ho ho. Do I detect a hint of wit? Rare to run into that in the Capital Wastes.

topics.topic_text: Yeah... better than you, deadeye.
topics.response_text: Yeah right. I could shoot the dick off of a fly at 100 yards without iron sights.

topics.topic_text: What do you mean "fellow relic hunter"?
topics.response_text: Come on... you and I both know this is where the Declaration of Independence is stashed... no need to be coy about it.

topics.topic_text: I'm not looking for anything. I'm just passing through.
topics.response_text: Passing through? Come on... you and I both know this is where the Declaration of Independence is stashed.

topics.topic_text: I don't have time for this crap.
topics.response_text: In a rush to get back to Abraham Washington for your reward, eh?

topics.topic_text: I don't work with strangers.
topics.response_text: Okay cowboy, go ahead and blunder through the place. You'll never make it to the Declaration let alone back to Rivet City for the reward.

topics.topic_text: What are you proposing?
topics.response_text: Simple. We pool our resources, grab the Declaration then make for Rivet City and split the reward.

topics.topic_text: Hang on, there. You need to tell me who you are before I agree to anything!
topics.response_text: I told you already. I'm a relic hunter just like you. I turn bits of trash into caps and then get my ass drunk.

topics.topic_text: Who's stupid enough to shell out a bunch of caps for a scrap of paper?
topics.response_text: Like I said, Abraham Washington, that's who. He's got plenty of caps and all kinds of valuables for trade.

topics.topic_text: Nope, not interested.
topics.response_text: Fine by me. I've waited this long to get the Declaration, I can wait 'til someone smarter comes along.

topics.topic_text: Whoa, whoa. Slow down. Let me think a minute.
topics.response_text: Slow huh? Okay. Hurry though, I don't want to wait here for more of those things to crack open my skull.

topics.topic_text: Sure, let's team up.
topics.response_text: Smart move.

topics.topic_text: How do I get to the Arlington Library?
topics.response_text: Oh, I know where that is. Here, lemme punch it into your PipBoy map.

topics.topic: MS15TLDeclarationTopicI have a few questions about the Declaration of Independence.
topics.topic_text: What do you know about the Declaration of Independence?
topics.response_text: All I know is that it looks like a rolled up piece of thick paper with all kinds of writing on it. Some famous document from a long time ago.

topics.topic_text: Since we're partners now, why don't you tell me about yourself?
topics.response_text: Ha, I'm surprised that you care. Usually everyone looks out for themselves nowadays.

topics.topic_text: How did you get into the relic hunting business?
topics.response_text: I dunno. I grew up like pretty much every other girl in this crappy world. Spent most of my life just trying to keep away from Slavers.

topics.topic_text: You recovered all of that stuff in the Preservation Society's museum?
topics.response_text: Oh no. There is more than a lifetime's supply of grade A crap in that place. Couldn't possibly do it alone. Like you, he hires anyone off the street.

topics.topic_text: Nice gun. I've never seen one like that.
topics.response_text: Yeah, it is nice. I don't even sleep without it under my pillow.

topics.topic_text: What happened to your father?
topics.response_text: Sorry. There's some things I still want to keep to myself. Maybe when I get to trust you better.

topics.topic_text: Are you hurt?
topics.response_text: Nope, I'm fine.

topics.topic_text: Wait here a minute.
topics.response_text: Oh no you don't. You have the Declaration on you now. I'm going to stick to you like glue until we reach Abraham Washington.

topics.topic_text: What's our next move?
topics.response_text: Let's head for Rivet City. It's a bit of a hike, but I want to get back there so I can start spending my caps!

conversation.response_text: Get the hell away from me.
Well don't just stand there gawking, get your ass down here and give me a hand!{Say loudly... you are calling up to a balcony overlook.}
They kept the Declaration in the Archives Strongroom that's at the end of the East wing here. We'll have to make our way to it.
There's all sorts of shortcuts through maintenance doors and utility gates to bypass security if you can get through 'em.
According to the plans, the turret generator is somewhere in this room. Disable it, and it should make our lives easier.
Up ahead should be the door to the Archives Strongroom. That's where they keep the Declaration.
This is the long way down to the East Wing. I'd suggest we head back to the Rotunda and take the cargo lift.
Get your ass over here if you want to live... and watch out for the mines! Quick, they're coming!
Lock 'n load... they'll be here any second!
Hang tight... there's always a second wave!
